jinja2.exceptions

Exceptions

TemplateError

Baseclass for all template errors.

TemplateNotFound

Raised if a template does not exist.

TemplatesNotFound

Like TemplateNotFound but raised if multiple templates

TemplateSyntaxError

Raised to tell the user that there is a problem with the template.

TemplateAssertionError

Like a template syntax error, but covers cases where something in the

TemplateRuntimeError

A generic runtime error in the template engine. Under some situations

UndefinedError

Raised if a template tries to operate on Undefined.

SecurityError

Raised if a template tries to do something insecure if the

FilterArgumentError

This error is raised if a filter was called with inappropriate

exception jinja2.exceptions.TemplateError(message: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: Exception

Baseclass for all template errors.

property message: str | None[source]
exception jinja2.exceptions.TemplateNotFound(name: str | jinja2.runtime.Undefined | None, message: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: OSError, LookupError, TemplateError

Raised if a template does not exist.

Changed in version 2.11: If the given name is Undefined and no message was provided, an UndefinedError is raised.

message: str | None = None[source]
name[source]
templates[source]
exception jinja2.exceptions.TemplatesNotFound(names: Sequence[str | jinja2.runtime.Undefined] = (), message: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: TemplateNotFound

Like TemplateNotFound but raised if multiple templates are selected. This is a subclass of TemplateNotFound exception, so just catching the base exception will catch both.

Changed in version 2.11: If a name in the list of names is Undefined, a message about it being undefined is shown rather than the empty string.

Added in version 2.2.

templates = [][source]
exception jinja2.exceptions.TemplateSyntaxError(message: str, lineno: int, name: str | None = None, filename: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: TemplateError

Raised to tell the user that there is a problem with the template.

translated = False[source]
exception jinja2.exceptions.TemplateAssertionError(message: str, lineno: int, name: str | None = None, filename: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: TemplateSyntaxError

Like a template syntax error, but covers cases where something in the template caused an error at compile time that wasn’t necessarily caused by a syntax error. However it’s a direct subclass of TemplateSyntaxError and has the same attributes.

exception jinja2.exceptions.TemplateRuntimeError(message: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: TemplateError

A generic runtime error in the template engine. Under some situations Jinja may raise this exception.

exception jinja2.exceptions.UndefinedError(message: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: TemplateRuntimeError

Raised if a template tries to operate on Undefined.

exception jinja2.exceptions.SecurityError(message: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: TemplateRuntimeError

Raised if a template tries to do something insecure if the sandbox is enabled.

exception jinja2.exceptions.FilterArgumentError(message: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: TemplateRuntimeError

This error is raised if a filter was called with inappropriate arguments
